sen.j: 良岑 安世（よしみね の やすよ、延暦4年（785年） - 天長7年7月6日 (旧暦)（830年8月2日））は、平安時代初期の公家。
sen.e: YOSHIMINE no Yasuyo (785-August 2, 830, which was July 6 according to the old calendar) was a court noble during the early Heian period.
YOSHIMINE no Yasuyo (785-August 2, 830, which was July 6 according to the old calendar) was a court noble during the early Heian period.
YOSHIMINE no Yasuyo (785-August 2, 830) was a court noble during the early Heian period.
sen.cmt: 旧暦表記を削除し、西暦（グレゴリオ暦)のみとしました。

sen.e: He was Imperial Prince of Emperor Kanmu.
He was Imperial Prince of Emperor Kanmu.
He was a prince of Emperor Kanmu.
His mother was KUDARA no Nagatsugu who was a lady of the court serving in the inner palace.
His mother was KUDARA no Nagatsugu who was a lady of the court serving in the inner palace.
His mother was KUDARA no Nagatsugu who was a lady of the court serving in the inner palace.

sen.j: 異父同母兄に藤原冬嗣がおり、子に遍昭（僧正遍昭）・良岑晨直などがいる。
sen.e: He had an older half brother FUJIWARA no Fuyutsugu, on his mother's side. His children included Henjo (Sojo Henjo) and YOSHIMINE no晨直.
sen.cmt: 良岑晨直→YOSHIMINE no ?[読み不明]
sen.e: He had an older half brother FUJIWARA no Fuyutsugu, on his mother's side. His children included Henjo (Sojo Henjo) and YOSHIMINE no晨直.
He had an older half brother FUJIWARA no Fuyutsugu, on his mother's side. His children included Henjo (Sojo Henjo) and YOSHIMINE no ? (良岑晨直).
sen.cmt: YOSHIMINE no晨直→YOSHIMINE no ? (良岑晨直)としました。

sen.e: He held the rank of Shonii (Senior Second Rank).
He held the rank of Shonii (Senior Second Rank).
He held the rank of Shonii (Senior Second Rank).

sen.j: 若くして狩猟を好み、技芸を好んだ。
sen.e: As a young man, he loved hunting and the performing arts.
As a young man, he loved hunting and the performing arts.
As a young man, he loved hunting and the performing arts.
In 802, he transferred out of the Imperial family and joined the subjects of the state.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In 802, he transferred out of the Imperial family and joined the subjects of the state.
In 802, he transferred out of the Imperial family and joined the subjects of the state.

sen.j: 良岑朝臣の姓を賜って、809年（大同 (日本)元年）従五位下に叙せられた。
sen.e: He used the name YOSHIMINE no Ason and was awarded Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) in 809.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He used the name YOSHIMINE no Ason and was awarded Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) in 809.
He used the name YOSHIMINE no Ason and was awarded Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) in 809.

sen.j: 武官を兼ね、書や音楽にも秀でていたという。
sen.e: He also held military posts, and excelled in calligraphy and music.
He also held military posts, and excelled in calligraphy and music.
He also held military posts, and excelled in calligraphy and music.

sen.j: 右近衛少将・雅楽頭・左大弁などを歴任し、811年（弘仁2年）には蔵人頭に任じられた。
sen.e: He was appointed Ukone no shosho (Minor Captain of the Right Division of Inner Palace Guards), Uta no kami (Director of the Bureau of Music), Sadaiben (Major Controller of the Left); and by 811, he held the post of Kurodo no to (Head Chamberlain)

He was appointed Ukone no shosho (Minor Captain of the Right Division of Inner Palace Guards), Uta no kami (Director of the Bureau of Music), Sadaiben (Major Controller of the Left); and by 811, he held the post of Kurodo no to (Head Chamberlain)

He was appointed Ukone no shosho (Minor Captain of the Right Division of Inner Palace Guards), Uta no kami (Director of the Bureau of Music), Sadaiben (Major Controller of the Left); and by 811, he held the post of Kurodo no to (Head Chamberlain).

sen.j: その後、左衛門督・右大弁を兼任した。
sen.e: Thereafter, he was appointed Saemon no kami (Captain of the Left Division of Outer Palace Guards) and Udaiben (Major Controller of the Right).
Thereafter, he was appointed Saemon no kami (Captain of the Left Division of Outer Palace Guards) and Udaiben (Major Controller of the Right).
Thereafter, he was appointed Saemon no kami (Captain of the Left Division of Outer Palace Guards) and Udaiben (Major Controller of the Right).

sen.j: 816年（弘仁7年）に参議、821年（弘仁12年）に従三位中納言に任じられた。
sen.e: He was appointed Sangi (Royal Advisor) in 816, and in 821, he was promoted to Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) and appointed Chunagon (Middle Counselor).
He was appointed Sangi (Royal Advisor) in 816, and in 821, he was promoted to Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) and appointed Chunagon (Middle Counselor).
He was appointed Sangi (Royal Advisor) in 816, and in 821, he was promoted to Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) and appointed Chunagon (vice-councilor of state).

sen.j: その後、按察使・春宮大夫・右近衛大将などを兼任している。
sen.e: He held the posts of Azechi (inspector of the provincial government), Togu no daibu (Master of the Crown Prince's Quarters) and Ukone no Daisho (Major Captain of the Right Division of Inner Palace Guards) concurrently.

He held the posts of Azechi (inspector of the provincial government), Togu no daibu (Master of the Crown Prince's Quarters) and Ukone no Daisho (Major Captain of the Right Division of Inner Palace Guards) concurrently.

He held the posts of Azechi (inspector of the provincial government), Togu no daibu (Master of the Crown Prince's Quarters) and Ukone no Daisho (Major Captain of the Right Division of Inner Palace Guards) concurrently.

sen.j: 828年（天長5年）には大納言にいたる。
sen.e: In 828, he was finally appointed Dainagon (Major Counselor).
In 828, he was finally appointed Dainagon (Major Counselor).
In 828, he was finally appointed Dainagon (chief councilor of state).
He died in 830 at the age of 46.
He died in 830 at the age of 46.
He died in 830 at the age of 46.

sen.j: 死後、従二位が追贈された。
sen.e: He was awarded Junii (Junior Second Rank) posthumously.
He was awarded Junii (Junior Second Rank) posthumously.
He was awarded Junii (Junior Second Rank) posthumously.

sen.j: 「日本後紀」「内裏式」の編纂にもかかわり、「経国集」にも漢詩が入集している。
sen.e: Yasuyo was involved in the compilation of "Nihon Koki" (the third of the six classical Japanese history texts) and "Dairishiki" (Ceremonial Book of the Court), and his writing was included in the "Keikokushu" ("Collection for ordering the state," Japan's third and last imperial anthology of literature in Chinese).

Yasuyo was involved in the compilation of "Nihon Koki" (the third of the six classical Japanese history texts) and "Dairishiki" (Ceremonial Book of the Court), and his writing was included in the "Keikokushu" ("Collection for ordering the state," Japan's third and last imperial anthology of literature in Chinese).

Yasuyo was involved in the compilation of 'Nihon Koki' (the third of the six classical Japanese history texts) and 'Dairishiki' (Ceremonial Book of the Court), and his writing was included in the 'Keikokushu' ('Collection for ordering the state,' Japan's third and last imperial anthology of literature in Chinese).

sen.j: 802年（延暦21）12月27日、臣籍降下により良岑朝臣の氏姓を賜う。
sen.e: December 27, 802 - He became subject of the state and used the name YOSHIMINE no Ason.
December 27, 802 - He became subject of the state and used the name YOSHIMINE no Ason.

Resigned from the posts of Sadaiben and Saemon no kami
Resigned from the posts of Sadaiben and Saemon no kami.

sen.j: 中納言・陸奥出羽按察使元の如し。
sen.e: Retained the posts of Chunagon and Mutsu Dewa Azechi
Retained the posts of Chunagon and Mutsu Dewa Azechi
Retained the posts of Chunagon and Mutsu Dewa Azechi.
sen.cmt: 統一リストの表記に変更、ピリオド追加

sen.j: 3月20日、春宮（のちの淳和天皇となる大伴親王）大夫を兼任。
sen.e: March 20 - Concurrently held the post of Togu Daibu (Master teacher of the Crown Prince) to Imperial Prince Otomo who later became Emperor Junna
March 20 - Concurrently held the post of Togu Daibu (Master teacher of the Crown Prince) to Imperial Prince Otomo who later became Emperor Junna
March 20: Concurrently held the post of Togu Daibu (Master teacher of the Crown Prince) to Imperial Prince Otomo who later became Emperor Junna.
sen.cmt: 統一リストの表記に変更、ピリオド追加

sen.j: 中納言・左兵衛督・陸奥出羽按察使元の如し。
sen.e: Retained the posts of Chunagon, Sahyoe no kami and Mutsu Dewa Azechi
Retained the posts of Chunagon, Sahyoe no kami and Mutsu Dewa Azechi
Retained his positions as Chunagon, Sahyoe no kami and Mutsu Dewa Azechi.
sen.cmt: 「元の如し」(如元)→統一表記に修正、ピリオド追加

sen.j: 823年（弘仁14）5月1日、右近衛大将を兼任。
sen.e: May 1, 823 - Concurrently held the post of Ukone no Daisho (Major Captain of the Right Division of Inner Palace Guards)
May 1, 823 - Concurrently held the post of Ukone no Daisho (Major Captain of the Right Division of Inner Palace Guards)
May 1, 823: Concurrently held the post of Ukone no Daisho (Major Captain of the Right Division of Inner Palace Guards).
sen.cmt: 統一リストの表記に変更、ピリオド追加

sen.e: Resigned from Sahyoe no kami
Resigned from Sahyoe no kami
Resigned from Sahyoe no kami.

sen.j: 4月27日、正三位に昇叙し、中納言・右近衛大将・陸奥出羽按察使元の如し。
sen.e: April 27 - Promoted to Shosanmi (Senior Third Rank) and retained the posts of Chunagon, Ukone no Daisho and Mutsu Dewa Azechi
April 27 - Promoted to Shosanmi (Senior Third Rank) and retained the posts of Chunagon, Ukone no Daisho and Mutsu Dewa Azechi
April 27: Promoted to Shosanmi (Senior Third Rank) and retained his positions as Chunagon, Ukone no Daisho and Mutsu Dewa Azechi.
sen.cmt: 統一リストの表記に変更、「元の如し」(如元)→統一表記に修正、ピリオド追加

sen.j: 8月、春宮（のちの仁明天皇となる正良親王）大夫を兼任。
sen.e: August - Concurrently held the post of Togu Daibu to Imperial Prince Masara who later became Emperor Ninmyo
August - Concurrently held the post of Togu Daibu to Imperial Prince Masara who later became Emperor Ninmyo
August: Concurrently held the post of Togu Daibu to Imperial Prince Masara who later became Emperor Ninmyo.
sen.cmt: 統一リストの表記に変更、ピリオド追加

sen.j: 825年（天長2）、陸奥出羽按察使を去る。
sen.e: 825 - Resigned from the post of Mutsu Dewa Azechi
825 - Resigned from the post of Mutsu Dewa Azechi
825: Resigned from the post of Mutsu Dewa Azechi.
sen.cmt: 統一リストの表記に変更、ピリオド追加

sen.e: February 20, 828 - Transferred to the post of Dainagon (Major Counselor)
February 20, 828 - Transferred to the post of Dainagon (Major Counselor)
February 20, 828: Transferred to the post of Dainagon.
sen.cmt: 統一リストの表記に変更、Dainagon→既出のため補足削除、ピリオド追加

sen.e: Retained the post of Ukone no Daisho
Retained the post of Ukone no Daisho
Retained his position as Ukone no Daisho.
sen.cmt: 「元の如し」(如元)→統一表記に修正、ピリオド追加

sen.e: July 6, 830 - Died
July 6, 830 - Died
July 6, 830: Died.
sen.cmt: 統一リストの表記に変更、ピリオド追加

sen.e: Age at death: 46, Awarded with Shonii (Senior Second Rank)
sen.cmt: ここでは正二位とありますが、上では従二位とあり、どちらが正確なのか不明です。
sen.e: Age at death: 46, Awarded with Shonii (Senior Second Rank)
He was 46 years old.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処「享年」→前文の内容から、Died at the age of 46とせず、He was 46 years oldとしました。

sen.e: July 7: Awarded with Shonii (Senior Second Rank).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処「7月7日」を訳出、ピリオド追加
